title: 114_s3446
content: The ADA Education and Reform Act of 2016 requires the Disability Rights Section of the Department of Justice to develop an education program for promoting access to public accommodations for persons with disabilities. This program includes training for professionals to guide remediation for potential violations of the Americans with Disabilities Act. Paragraph (1) of section 308(a) of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 is amended to provide remedies and procedures for individuals facing discrimination based on disability. This includes protection against discrimination and the right to seek remedies under the Civil Rights Act of 1964. The Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 is amended to provide remedies and procedures for discrimination based on disability. A civil action for failure to remove architectural barriers in public accommodations requires a specific written notice to the owner. The Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 is amended to provide remedies and procedures for discrimination based on disability. A civil action for failure to remove architectural barriers in public accommodations requires a specific written notice to the owner. The notice must include a written description outlining improvements to remove the barrier, and if the owner fails to comply within 120 days, legal action can be taken. The written notice required for a violation must detail the circumstances of the denial of access to a public accommodation, including the property address, specific alleged violations, requests for assistance with architectural barriers, and the nature of the barrier. The Act and its amendments will take effect 30 days after enactment. Mediation for ADA actions related to architectural barriers is also included. SEC. 5. The Judicial Conference of the United States will develop a model program for mediation of ADA actions related to architectural barriers, aiming to resolve claims efficiently without costly litigation. The program will include a stay of discovery during mediation and an expedited method for determining relevant facts.
